task.title: Referring the CSS from a Publishing Template

note.p: You can specify an additional CSS in a in the associated publishing template descriptor.

step.cmd: Create a new publishing template. Skip this step you have already one.
Open the template descriptor associated with your publishing template. If you are not familiar with concept, you can follow the edit a publishing template procedure.
Using the project view, copy your custom CSS in a inner folder within publishing template root folder, in the custom_footer_template/resources folder for instance.
step.stepresult: You should have the custom_footer_template/resources/wh_footer.css file in your publishing package root folder.

step.cmd: Open the publishing template descriptor in editor to edit. You will benefit by the content completion and validation support.
Add the new CSS in the descriptor resources section. This will instruct the transformation to link the wh_footer.css in all generated HTML files.
Open the DITA Map WebHelp Responsive transformation scenario.
Use the Choose Custom Publishing Template and select your newly created template.
Click OK to save the changes to the transformation scenario.

result.p: Your custom CSS snippet will be applied as a final layer on top of any existing CSS rules and the output will reflect the changes you made.
